title: Int8Array
markdown:
# Int8Array

The **`Int8Array`** typed array represents an array of twos-complement 8-bit signed integers. The contents are initialized to `0`. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).

`Int8Array` is a subclass of the hidden [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray) class.

## [Constructor](#constructor)

[Int8Array()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Int8Array/Int8Array)

Creates a new `Int8Array` object.

## [Static properties](#static%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits static properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

[Int8Array.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `1` in the case of `Int8Array`.

## [Static methods](#static%5Fmethods)

_Inherits static methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Instance properties](#instance%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits instance properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

These properties are defined on `Int8Array.prototype` and shared by all `Int8Array` instances.

[Int8Array.prototype.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `1` in the case of a `Int8Array`.

[Int8Array.prototype.constructor](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object/constructor)

The constructor function that created the instance object. For `Int8Array` instances, the initial value is the [Int8Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Int8Array/Int8Array) constructor.

## [Instance methods](#instance%5Fmethods)

_Inherits instance methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Different ways to create an Int8Array](#different%5Fways%5Fto%5Fcreate%5Fan%5Fint8array)

```
// From a length
const int8 = new Int8Array(2);
int8[0] = 42;
console.log(int8[0]); // 42
console.log(int8.length); // 2
console.log(int8.BYTES_PER_ELEMENT); // 1

// From an array
const x = new Int8Array([21, 31]);
console.log(x[1]); // 31

// From another TypedArray
const y = new Int8Array(x);
console.log(y[0]); // 21

// From an ArrayBuffer
const buffer = new ArrayBuffer(8);
const z = new Int8Array(buffer, 1, 4);
console.log(z.byteOffset); // 1

// From an iterable
const iterable = (function* () {
  yield* [1, 2, 3];
})();
const int8FromIterable = new Int8Array(iterable);
console.log(int8FromIterable);
// Int8Array [1, 2, 3]

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

| Specification                                                                                                         |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ECMAScript Language Specification  \# table-49](https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/indexed-collections.html#table-49) |

BCD tables only load in the browser
